decks.notes: The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing powerful disruptive and countering spells to control the game while ramping into a combo win condition without needing traditional lands. By using cards like Disrupting Shoal, Force of Negation, and Jwari Disruption to disrupt opponents' game plans and protect key combo pieces like Hydroelectric Specimen and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning board state. The inclusion of cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention help to accelerate the deck's game plan, ultimately leading to a successful combo finish.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. The deck utilizes Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's card advantage and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the tempo of the game. With a mix of control elements and versatile cards such as Solitude and Isochron Scepter, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition and strategic plays.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. It utilizes strong early game creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride to boost its creatures' power and toughness. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Elegant Parlor add disruption to the opponent's game plan, while Arena of Glory provides a way to protect the deck's creatures.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with the help of Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. In addition, control elements such as Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command help to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also includes cards like Talisman of Impulse and Ancient Stirrings to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary pieces. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game through ramping and casting high-impact Eldrazi threats.

This deck focuses on cheating out big creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Griselbrand early in the game by using cards like Nourishing Shoal and Pact of Negation. The goal is to win quickly by assembling the Allosaurus combo and leveraging powerful abilities like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for key pieces. The deck also includes protection cards like Veil of Summer and Consign to Memory to ensure the combo can go off smoothly. Other cards like Xenagos, God of Revels and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant provide additional ways to win the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay by utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Witch Enchanter to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. The main goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells, while also having the ability to adapt to different board states with cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creature attacks with disruptive spells to control the board and slow down the opponent's game plan. By playing efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and powerful removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Quantum Riddler and Teferi, Time Raveler to further disrupt the opponent's plays and maintain control of the game. The strategy revolves around quickly overwhelming the opponent while maintaining board control through disruption and removal spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate mana quickly and cast a large number of spells in a single turn. The goal is to set up a powerful combo turn using cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Past in Flames to generate a lethal Grapeshot or other finisher. The deck aims to win the game in one explosive turn, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and burn damage. It is a high-risk, high-reward strategy that requires precise timing and sequencing to execute successfully.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption and removal spells while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining control elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones, the deck aims to put the opponent on the back foot and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp allows for additional versatility and synergy within the deck, creating unexpected plays and advantages.

This deck aims to generate a lot of mana quickly and efficiently using cards like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, and Manamorphose. The key strategy is to chain together mana-producing spells and draw effects to build towards casting Past in Flames and then Grapeshot for a lethal storm count. Ral, Monsoon Mage is a key piece in generating additional mana and card draw, while Wrenn's Resolve helps protect important combo pieces. The deck also includes some wish effects for additional versatility and utility in different situations. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive and fast-paced combo gameplay.

The deck focuses on efficiently milling the opponent's deck using cards like Archive Trap, Fractured Sanity, Ruin Crab, and Hedron Crab. The goal is to deplete the opponent's library quickly and win the game through milling before they can assemble their win conditions. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Path to Exile, Supreme Verdict, and Surgical Extraction to remove threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Visions of Beyond allows for card draw when the opponent's library is depleted, maintaining card advantage throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Counterspell and Cryptic Command, while also utilizing removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash to deal with threats. Card advantage is gained through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Snapcaster Mage, allowing the player to maintain control of the game. Overall, the deck utilizes a combination of control elements to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and generating value through sacrificing and recurring them. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and disruptive spells, while also benefiting from card advantage and mana ramp. The key strategy revolves around utilizing artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to power out threats like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, while using cards like Metallic Rebuke and Unholy Heat to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has access to powerful utility lands like Urza's Saga to further enhance its board presence.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Ulamog, and Devourer of Destiny to control the game and disrupt opponents' strategies. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms provide additional control elements, while cards like Kozilek's Command and Trinisphere help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and control the game with its powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to pressure the opponent. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to control the board. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to protect our creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to close out games. Consign to Memory and Arena of Glory provide additional value and card advantage to outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements such as Quantum Riddler and Consign to Memory to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly, using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to clear the way for attacks. Additionally, cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide extra utility and flexibility in managing the battlefield.
